snippet: As President Obama gave an impassioned speech in Connecticut, Republicans on Capitol Hill were threatening to prevent a gun-control measure from even coming up for debate.
abstract: Pres Obama travels to Connecticut and gives an impassioned speech promising that the Newtown deaths will not recede and reminding Americans how important their voice is as gun control debates unfold; declaration, at times taking on fervor of a campaign speech, comes even as Congressional Republicans threaten to prevent a gun-control measure from even coming up for debate.

byline.original: By PETER APPLEBOME and JONATHAN WEISMAN
byline.contributor: Peter Applebome reported from Hartford, and Jonathan Weisman from Washington. Jackie Calmes contributed reporting from Hartford, and Jennifer Steinhauer from Washington.

lead_paragraph: As President Obama gave an impassioned speech in Connecticut, Republicans on Capitol Hill were threatening to prevent a gun-control measure from even coming up for debate.

headline.seo: Obama in Connecticut to Push for Gun Control
headline.main: Obama Invokes Newtown Dead in Pressing for New Gun Laws
headline.print_headline: Invoking Newtown Dead, Obama Presses Gun Laws
